Crime_Name: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act Violation
Legal_Issue: Did the officer fail to consider cumulative persecution in the PRRA application?
Application_Facts: Officer acknowledged individual risks but did not evaluate them cumulatively in the PRRA decision, unlike the H&C decision.
Decision_Outcome: PRRA and H&C decisions were set aside for redetermination by a different officer.
Court_Ruling: Judicial review allowed; error found in failing to assess cumulative persecution.
Claimant_Status: Applicant claimed refugee protection but was denied; subsequent H&C and PRRA applications rejected.
Grounds_for_Claim: Cumulative persecution risk not assessed in PRRA despite multiple discriminatory acts.
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness for factual findings; correctness for procedural fairness.
Assessment_Factor: Cumulative assessment of risks from multiple discriminatory acts.
Procedural_Issue: Failure to apply procedural fairness in assessing cumulative risks.
Application_Basis: Persecution risk based on cumulative discriminatory acts.
Relief_Sought: Redetermination of PRRA and H&C applications by a different officer.
Governing_Rule: Officers must assess risks cumulatively if multiple discriminatory acts exist under IRPA.
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to consider cumulative effect of individual risks.
Harm_Assessment: Potential harm due to failure to recognize cumulative persecution risk.
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed refugee protection but was denied. Subsequent H&C and PRRA applications were also rejected.
Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA requirements for cumulative risk assessment in PRRA.
Decision_Rationale: Omission of cumulative risk assessment could have affected outcome; procedural fairness required.
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of cumulative evaluation of established individual risks.
